channel.title: Ok Ive been thinking how do I
channel.description:
How do I make an object? say like a door.
little tut would be nice

item.title: Ok Ive been thinking how do I
item.dc:creator: @LEL LEL
item.description:
@LEL wrote:

Adding a door, still won’t make it “function”.

When added the door, add this to your cases:

Base, of it:

case DOORID:
ReplaceObject(XCORD, YCORD, NEWFACINGID, -10);
ReplaceObject(XCORD, YCORD, NEWFACINGID, -10); //Incase more than one door
break;

Read full topic

item.title: Ok Ive been thinking how do I
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Dude99 Rich Dude99
item.description:
@Rich_Dude99 wrote:

Well… Doors are hard to make… but other objects are not. Just use Global Objects. And add the object where you need it. It should be in your source.

Search public void NewObjects in your client.java and you can add objects there!

Here is a format: makeGlobalObject(CoordX, CoordY, ObjectID, Facing, 10);
*NOTE: the part “makeGlobalObject” maybe diffrent in your server it may be like “addaobject” or other things if so just change it to the desired text.

CoordX= The X coordinate you want your object placed in. CoordY= The Y coordinate you want your object placed in. ObjectID= The ID of the object you want to create, see my attached text document. Facing= The direction you want the object to be faced: 0,-1,-2,-3 10= Just there, don't need to edit that.

Attached is a object list of all the objects.

Read full topic
item.source: Ok Ive been thinking how do I

item.title: Ok Ive been thinking how do I
item.dc:creator: @bmxr4c3r709 bmxr4c3r709
item.description:
@bmxr4c3r709 wrote:

Don’t know of any tuts… but search for

public void newobjects

Under it your should see something like this(Not exactly the same, but something LIKE this)

	               	                AddGlobalObject(3255, 3437, 2513, -2, 10);//range 

target
	               AddGlobalObject(3257, 3437, 2513, -2, 10);//range target
	               AddGlobalObject(3254, 3431, 381, -1, 10);//bookcase
	               AddGlobalObject(3256, 3431, 381, -1, 10);//bookcase

	               AddGlobalObject(3259, 3435, 2213, -1, 10);//bank booth
	               AddGlobalObject(3259, 3436, 2213, -1, 10);//bank booth
	               AddGlobalObject(3259, 3437, 2213, -1, 10);//bank booth
		AddGlobalObject(3227, 3441, 2213, -2, 10);//bank booth

		AddGlobalObject(3253, 3435, 635, -2, 10);//Money stall(theiving)

		AddGlobalObject(3262, 3426, 1278, -2, 10);//Regular Tree
		AddGlobalObject(3262, 3422, 1281, -2, 10);//Oak tree
		AddGlobalObject(3262, 3419, 1308, -2, 10);//Willow Tree
		AddGlobalObject(3262, 3416, 1307, -2, 10);//Maple Tree
		AddGlobalObject(3262, 3413, 1309, -2, 10);//Yew Tree
		AddGlobalObject(3262, 3410, 1306, -2, 10);//Magic Tree

Then, under that last one you see, add this

AddGlobalObject(Xcoords, Ycoords, ObjectID, face, 10)//objectname

The face is the way the object faces, those can be 0, -1, -2, or -3. I can’t remember which number is which direction so you will have to test.

Read full topic
item.source: Ok Ive been thinking how do I

item.title: Ok Ive been thinking how do I
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

To add an object, you must add this in your client.java. I will not tell you where to put it and i hope you will learn something:

[code]
public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
}
}
}
}
}

public void ReplaceObject2(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));

	outStream.createFrame(101);
	outStream.writeByteC((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	outStream.writeByte(0);

	if (NewObjectID != -1) {
		outStream.createFrame(151);
		outStream.writeByteS(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
		outStream.writeByteS((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
		//FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
		//ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration
	}
}

public void NewObjects() {[/code]

To make a new object, you must add something like this under:

public void NewObjects() {
makeGlobalObject(2843, 3336, 358, 0, 10);//Crate

This makes a crate in Entrana. To make your own, you must do this:

makeGlobalObject([xcoord], [ycoord], [objectid], [direction], 10);//[objectname]

Read full topic
